intro: Bunioseris, commonly known as the golden ragwort, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its bright yellow flowers and is native to regions in Europe and parts of Asia. The plants typically grow in dry, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. Bunioseris species often have narrow, linear leaves and produce small, clustered flower heads. They are generally herbaceous perennials, though some species may behave as annuals depending on the climate.
